This problem does not occur when running the RAC.  All events are received and 
test log marked as successful.
This looks like a must fix for 4.1.

I suggest raising the severity of this one -- I remember seeing something like
this back a month or more ago when IAC was always causing event loses (at first
we thought we were just not getting the stop events), this looks like it could
be another case of that.
Mark/Scott, can you send me that URL test case/suite? Thanks.
Mark, which driver(build date) are you using? Is it just Linux?

Build is 200511150100 on Linux only (haven't tested Windows yet - will update 
bugzilla after testing on windows if it is a problem).

An interesting thing I found during attempts to reproduce the problem.  I 
always get the NPE when running the test after generating the junit code in a 
project with shared src/bin directory.  When I take this testsuite and copy it 
to a project with separate folders for src and bin, generate and execute it, 
it works fine with no problems.   

I will the testsuite I am having a problem with

Created an attachment (id=30069)
Testsuite causing NPE during execution with IAC on Linux.

This is the testsuite I am having a problem with.

Note that when running with Sun JDK 1.5 I need to start the shell like this:

bash --noprofile --norc

For some unknown reasons the existance of certain environment variables will
prevent the RemoteSession agent to correctly query the system envivonment
variables. This will cause the Executor agent fail to come up. Starting the
shell with "--noprofile" and "--norc" will make sure those unfriendly
environment variables from adding to the system environment.

I cannot reproduce the problem using the attached test suite. The driver used is
200511160100. I would suggest this to be fix as a P1 in 4.2. Agree?
Hendra, please confirm if this defect is still a 4.1 candidate or if it is fixed.
Transfering to 4.2 as per conversation with Mark.

I am in favor of deferring this defect.  I can not reproduce it with any new recording/testsuite . It seems related to the test name.  There is something unusual about the attached testsuite - it has a long name with spaces and periods.  When I delete the long name with spaces, save it, regenerate it and run it, the problem no longer occurs.
Deferring to 4.2. After 4.1, should try to recreate the long testname to see if it is a real issue either in IAC or some other part of TPTP.
This bug seems to be the same as 128544 because i've got the same NP exception.
Transfer all normal severity bugs to 4.3
Not containable in 4.3 and retarget to 4.4. Please let me know if you have any concern.
Retarget to future due to resource limitation.
Should be resolved once bug 173330 is implemented.
Not in the official plan but will try and fix in i3.
This should now be fixed under bug 173330.  Memory of IAC is no longer shared with the Eclipse process.
I just verified that this now works.
